intro: Suttonia neozealandensis, commonly known as the New Zealand suttonia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or rocky soils. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Suttonia neozealandensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
